credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: He gave to her, yet tenfold claim'd in return -
sections.spanish: Él le dio a ella, y aun así reclamó diez veces más a cambio –

sections.original: She hath no life but the one he for her wrought;
sections.spanish: Ella no tiene vida más que la que él forjó para ella ;

sections.original: Proffer'd to her his wauking heart - she turn'd it down,
sections.spanish: Le ofreció su corazón despierto – ella lo rechazó ,

sections.original: Riposted with a tell-tale lore of lies and scorn.
sections.spanish: y respondió con un relato revelador de mentiras y desprecio.

sections.original: Prophetess or fond?,
Tho' her parle of truth:
"I ken to-morrow - refell me if ye can!",
Yet the kiss and breath - Apollo's bane -
sections.spanish: sin embargo, el beso y su aliento – la perdición de Apolo –

sections.original: Sëer of the future, not of twain,
sections.spanish: vidente del futuro, no del presente ,

sections.original: "Sicker!", quoth Cassandra.
Still, is she lief and quaint in his eyne, a sight divine? -
sections.spanish: Aun así, ¿él la ve amada y encantadora, una visión divina? –

sections.original: A mistress fuell'd by his prest haughtiness -
sections.spanish: una amante alimentada por su altivez –

sections.original: If he did grant, wherefore then did he not foresee,
sections.spanish: si él concedió, ¿por qué no previó entonces?

sections.original: Belike egal as it to him might be?!
Prophetess or fond?,
Tho' her parle of truth:
"I ken to-morrow - refell me if ye can!",
Yet the kiss and breath - Apollo's bane -
sections.spanish: sin embargo, el beso y su aliento – la perdición de Apolo –

sections.original: Sëer of the future, not of twain,
sections.spanish: vidente del futuro, no del presente ,

sections.original: "Sicker!", quoth Cassandra.
'Or was he an eried being,
'Or was he weening - alack nay mo;
Her naysay' raught his heart,
Her daffing was the grave of all hope -
sections.spanish: su burla fue la tumba de toda esperanza –

sections.original: She belied her own words,
He thought her life, save moreo'er scourge,
sections.spanish: él veía su vida, salvo mayor aflicción ,

sections.original: She held him august, yet wee;
sections.spanish: ella lo hallaba majestuoso, aunque diminuto ;

sections.original: He left her ne'er without his heart.
sections.spanish: él nunca la dejó sin su corazón.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Ferie dearest, was it loe soothfast or a façade;
sections.spanish: Ferie querida, ¿era el amor tan sincero o una farsa?

sections.original: A serenade siren'd to lure - Zounds! not to court me?
sections.spanish: ¿Una serenata para seducir? ¡Maldita sea! ¿no para enamorarme?

sections.original: A menad, yet the sweetest colleen -
sections.spanish: Una ménade, y sin embargo la doncella más dulce –

sections.original: Certes didst thou me unveil meekly life pristine.
sections.spanish: ciertamente revelaste la vida pura con humildad.

sections.original: Lorelei,
A poet of tragedies, scribe I lauds to Death,
sections.spanish: poeta de tragedias, escribo alabanzas a la Muerte,

sections.original: Yet who the hell was I to dare?
sections.spanish: ¿pero quién demonios era yo para atreverme?

sections.original: Lorelei,
Canst thou not see thou to me needful art?
sections.spanish: ¿no ves que eres indispensable para mí?

sections.original: Canst thou not see the loss of loe painful is?
sections.spanish: ¿no ves lo dolorosa que es la pérdida del amor?

sections.original: Dedally didst thou perform the tragic pasquinade,
sections.spanish: Con habilidad representaste la triste parodia,

sections.original: For all years a damndest and driegh'd accolade -
sections.spanish: durante años un elogio maldito y árido –

sections.original: Caus'd for all eyes mazed to behold a mêlee;
sections.spanish: hiciste que miradas atónitas contemplaran la pelea;

sections.original: In the midst did I swainly cast thee my bouquet:
sections.spanish: en medio de todo, con galantería te lancé mi ramo:

sections.original: The one and sole faggot that feedeth the fire,
sections.spanish: el único haz de leña que aviva el fuego,

sections.original: Bellow'd bidingly by my heart's quailing quire.
sections.spanish: rugía al unísono con el latido vacilante de mi corazón.

sections.original: Lorelei,
A poet of tragedies, scribe I lauds to Death,
sections.spanish: poeta de tragedias, escribo alabanzas a la Muerte,

sections.original: Yet who the hell was I to dare?
sections.spanish: ¿pero quién demonios era yo para atreverme?

sections.original: Lorelei,
Canst thou not see thou to me needful art?
sections.spanish: ¿no ves que eres indispensable para mí?

sections.original: Canst thou not see the loss of loe painful is?
sections.spanish: ¿no ves lo dolorosa que es la pérdida del amor?

sections.original: Perchance author I thee this ikon'd apologue for aught,
sections.spanish: Quizá te escriba esta fábula icónica por algún motivo,

sections.original: Doth the wecht burthen thee?, then bethink thine afterthought:
sections.spanish: ¿te agobia este peso? entonces reflexiona después:

sections.original: 'Tween Aether and 'Nether art thou the peerless phoenix -
sections.spanish: entre el Éter y el Inframundo eres el fénix incomparable –

sections.original: Prithee, darlingmost! - court me rather than the peevish prolix.
sections.spanish: ¡te lo ruego, mi adorada! corteja a mí en lugar de a la tediosa prolijidad.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Thou dawdl'd not bringing me fro Aether to Nether,
sections.spanish: No tardaste en traerme del Éter al Inframundo ,

sections.original: Still, duringly cling I on to this heather -
sections.spanish: sin embargo permanezco aferrado a esta brecina –

sections.original: Dew-scented blossom; thou wast pristine,
sections.spanish: flor perfumada de rocío; eras inmaculada ,

sections.original: The sweven of thee ne'er will I cede, my colleen.
sections.spanish: jamás cederé tu visión, mi doncella.

sections.original: Drat this creature of memories ill,
sections.spanish: Maldita sea esta criatura de recuerdos funestos ,

sections.original: Foolhardy and fey I may be, yet him I shall quell.
sections.spanish: pueda ser imprudente y fantasioso, pero a él someteré.

sections.original: 'Vaunt! - Devil tyne -
Wadst thou wane fore'ermae;
Daunt - sinsyne thence,
Ta'en as a dint, Angelique?
Perforce and grinningly shall I maim in the vie -
sections.spanish: A la fuerza y con sonrisa mutilaré en la batalla –

sections.original: Alas dastard! - hanging by the noose die.
sections.spanish: ¡Ay, cobarde! morirás colgado de la soga.

sections.original: 'Vaunt! - Devil tyne -
Wadst thou wane fore'ermae;
Daunt - sinsyne thence,
Ta'en as a dint, Angelique?
'Come not wont to this uncouth Devil!,
sections.spanish: ¡No te acerques a este demonio inculto!,

sections.original: Lest to a Devil thou wilt translate...my Angel.
sections.spanish: no sea que me traduzcas en demonio… mi ángel.

sections.original: 'Vaunt! - Devil tyne -
Wadst thou wane fore'ermae;
Daunt - sinsyne thence,
Ta'en as a dint, Angelique?

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Parch'd of words, parch'd of lauds,
sections.spanish: Sedienta de palabras, sedienta de elogios ,

sections.original: Lorn and tyned fro my wame -
sections.spanish: perdida y arrancada de mi seno –

sections.original: 'Seech I more perforce indeed:
sections.spanish: deseo más con urgencia en verdad :

sections.original: Lap I of thee: Thou art want.
With dulcet gust thine floret,
Which I yet would not do -
Pray I thee for thine avail -
Lave me in it; I want more!
For my loe, not be adust.
Come see as the wind: Chant -
sections.spanish: ven y observa como el viento: canta –

sections.original: I let thee come in -
Come see as the wind, Aoede.
sections.spanish: ven y observa como el viento, Eoides.

sections.original: As of lote - upon thee dote,
sections.spanish: como de loto – me enamoro de ti ,

sections.original: Lowing 'tis, true forsooth,
Tisn't a tongue, nay merely mote,
sections.spanish: no es una lengua, sino simple sílaba ,

sections.original: Thou art grandly mae than couth':
sections.spanish: eres mucho más noble que la elegancia:

sections.original: Eft and e'er doth it eke -
sections.spanish: una y otra vez lo acrecienta –

sections.original: I am what I do behold.
For my loe, not be adust.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Haste not thine wisdom, for the hollow is ta'en -
sections.spanish: No apresures tu sabiduría, pues el vacío ha sido ocupado –

sections.original: By whom, know I not; 'lack! am I of twain -
sections.spanish: por quién, no lo sé; ¡ay!, estoy incompleto –

sections.original: And as a crux - cede I my words -
sections.spanish: y como cruce – cedo mis palabras –

sections.original: Fro my heart wilt thou ne'er
Have I been 'sooth sinsyne.
Be left without - come!
Thine voice is oh so sweet, I speer thine pine,
sections.spanish: tu voz es tan dulce, anhelo tu pasión ,

sections.original: Ryking for me:
Ryking for thee;
"List and heed", thou say'st
Wistful, whistful -
Chancing to lure.
Skirl and skreigh, but for thine ears, aye, lown 'tis -
sections.spanish: gime y aúlla, pero para tus oídos, sí, es bajo –

sections.original: Dodge na 'way herefro, do come here in eath!
sections.spanish: no huyas de aquí, ¡ven a la tierra!

sections.original: Mayhap lured by the scent of lote -
sections.spanish: Quizá atraído por el aroma de loto –

sections.original: 'Od! - the foetid - eft hie back I mote;
sections.spanish: ¡Dios! – lo fétido – debo volver de prisa ,

sections.original: For what I did my soul atrounced,
sections.spanish: pues lo que hice albergó mi alma ,

sections.original: How I wish for thee again,
O! do believe me, 'twasn't a frounce.
Will I give thee it: Troth.
Thine voice is oh so sweet, I speer thine pine,
sections.spanish: tu voz es tan dulce, anhelo tu pasión ,

sections.original: Ryking for me:
Ryking for thee;
"List and heed", thou say'st
Wistful, whistful -
Chancing to lure.
Dodge na 'way herefro, do come here in eath!
sections.spanish: no huyas de aquí, ¡ven a la tierra!

credits: [Bonus track] [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Cede the wherefores and do na chide,
sections.spanish: Cede las razones y no reproches ,

sections.original: Maybe I am peenging - ween of joy;
Cede the wherefores and do na chide -
sections.spanish: cede las razones y no reproches –

sections.original: Thrawn and slab of leer I hold thee, and yore was 'gal.
sections.spanish: obstinada y fría te sostengo, como antaño igualmente.

sections.original: Riddance,
Sith the one.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Circa mea pectora multa sunt suspiria
sections.spanish: En mi pecho hay numerosos suspiros

sections.original: De tua pulchritudine, que me ledunt misere.
sections.spanish: por tu belleza, que me hieren con miseria.

sections.original: Venus! - I trow'd thou wast my friend -
Professed to Heaven thou wouldst send;
As a disciple of a villain
Didst thou act the tragedienne.
Iam amore virginali totus ardeo.
Amor volat undique, captus est libidine.
sections.spanish: El amor vuela por doquier, cautivo de la lujuria.

sections.original: Tui lucent oculi sicut solis radij,
sections.spanish: Tus ojos brillan como rayos de sol,

sections.original: Sicut splendor fulguris, qui lucem donat tenebris.
sections.spanish: como el esplendor del relámpago que otorga luz a las tinieblas.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Dream of a funeral, blest temptress - behest me! -
sections.spanish: Sueño con un funeral, bendita tentadora – ¡ordénamelo! –

sections.original: A funeral thou'lt hark, swarth murderess - the Devil,
sections.spanish: un funeral escucharás, oscura homicida – el Diablo,

sections.original: Thine feral grith with me, Poppea, be Hell's hap;
sections.spanish: tu abrazo salvaje conmigo, Poppea, sea la suerte del Infierno ;

sections.original: Waylaid the beldame bawd, the niggard: Laughing tragedy.
sections.spanish: embosqué a la vieja alcahueta, la avara: tragedia risueña.

sections.original: And the wench doth bawdness to blow,
Stay my adamant -
Suffer me to transfix thee;
And the wench doth bawdness to blow,
Let me dawt thine twain -
And, twine 'hem apart.
Of marrow, do na mell; I am Morelle -
sections.spanish: no toques la médula; soy Morrel –

sections.original: The bosom'd Titivil; travail me; a fáin,
sections.spanish: el voluptuoso Titivil; trabajad en mí; un placer,

sections.original: Subdue me with thine lote in oneness - make haste yet,
sections.spanish: sométeme con tu loto en unidad – apresura el paso,

sections.original: Displode me in a font - Poppea, do what thou wilt.
sections.spanish: rebólsame en la fuente – Poppea, haz lo que desees.

sections.original: And the wench doth bawdness to blow,
Stay my adamant -
Suffer me to transfix thee;
And the wench doth bawdness to blow,
Let me dawt thine twain -
And, twine 'hem apart.

credits: [Words by Raymond, Music by Theatre of Tragedy]

sections.original: Ado with a mean woe,
An ado as aglow:
Belying the paynim
Thou rewrot'st the tome -
An ivy-crown'd and dancing,
And fawn'd and trancing -
Espying the surly wud,
And heeding her not.
Afear'd of Bacchante,
And dost thou 'hold the yill? -
Behind is the sleepless;
Eyne 'holding na mo.
«Onto the paper scribe I the words that fro my heart move -
sections.spanish: «Al papel escribo las palabras que brotan de mi corazón –

sections.original: With every dight letter, with the ebb of ink,
sections.spanish: con cada letra trazada, con el fluir de la tinta ,

sections.original: The point of the quill my penmanship doth mirror;
sections.spanish: la punta de la pluma refleja mi escritura ;

sections.original: Tales of theft and adultery,
Tales of devilment and witchery -
Tales of me.
Celebration Bacchari
Twit me, I am thy tyke;
sections.spanish: Burláte de mí, soy tu insignificante;

sections.original: Meekness for thee aught.
sections.spanish: la mansedumbre para ti vale de algo.

sections.original: Yerk me to weal daut',
Sweven nor Muse
Wad taw me to this ruddy hue -
sections.spanish: me atraerían a este tono encarnado –

sections.original: Wark aptly my drear,
'Hesting dirdum:
Heyday! - a swingeing shrew.
Skelp me - gar me pain,
Pray soft; tender ache.
Yerk me to weal daut',
Sweven nor Muse
Wad taw me to this ruddy hue -
sections.spanish: me atraerían a este tono encarnado –

sections.original: Wark aptly my drear,
'Hesting dirdum:
Heyday! - a swingeing shrew.
